texts.text: Ugh...
Ah...
Immediately upon waking, I realize there's something in front of me.
My view grows clearer as my groggy eyes adapt to the light.
...Rin?
...Olivia?
...Sumomo?
No...
She's not.
Something feels off.
It doesn't feel like the same person.
It isn't her.
Huh? Where am I?
I slowly sit up.
The metal frame of the bed creaks in protest.
I put a hand to my forehead.
Right, I...
I was dreaming.
The fog in my mind slowly clears.
Right, there was a white-haired girl in my dream too.
I was a middle-aged literature professor.
...No, an adjunct professor.
Right, there was a white-haired woman in the dream too.
I was a young man working in a pub. Then I became a playwright.
None other than Shakespeare himself.
Why did I confuse her for Sumomo?
Ah, it must be the eyes.
They're the same color as hers.
But...
I can't remember anything before that.
Huh? I...
I scan the room slowly.
Next to me is a bed just like mine.
The two beds are the only things in the otherwise stark and empty room.
Where am I? Who is she?
Who am I?
I put a hand to my forehead and think.
I can't remember a thing.
All I can recall is the dream I just had.
Were you sleeping too?
The girl doesn't answer.
Upon further inspection, I realize she's not even really looking at me.
She's just staring blankly in my general direction.
Just then, the door to the room opens.
Another girl comes into the room.
And beside her, hovering in the air, is a small robot made up of spheres like a snowman.
Good morning.
Uh...
I imagine you have questions. This way.
She abruptly turns her back on us.
Err, um...
Yes?
The white-haired girl trots over to the open door, barefoot.
Seeing this, the other girl walks to the bed and picks up a pair of sandals before returning to the doorway.
She doesn't seem to mean us any harm, at least.
Are you coming?
Uh, okay.
I hurriedly get to my feet.
The polished white floor feels warm against my soles.
I notice a pair of sandals lined up beside my own bed. I put them on and hurry to the exit.
The interior of the whole place appears consistently drab.
Everything feels unnatural and inorganic.
And yet, I can smell a faint trace of a wooden scent.
The corridor is also warm.
The whole place seems to maintain a placid temperature.
As we walk, I think of what questions to ask.
Here.
The girl places a big, round plate in front of me.
She does the same for the white-haired girl.
The two plates are set perfectly perpendicular to each other.
But she doesn't do the same for herself. Maybe she ate before.
I wonder to myself as I scoop up some food with my spoon and bring it to my mouth.
It's a slightly sweet porridge-like substance.
It warms me up and makes my stomach clamor for more.
I spoon bite after bite into my mouth.
Then, I raise my face.
I see that the white-haired girl is also eating.
The other girl simply stares at me in silence.
Um...
Yes?
Where are we?
This is a facility called the Environmental Redevelopment Research Institute.
That's, uh...
The research facility's main goal is to create a safe surface environment where humans can subsist.
I see.
I think I asked the wrong question.
I understood most of the words she said.
I understand what she's saying in general.
No one can live on the surface.
That's obvious. Anyone could tell you that.
What I want to know is...
How much memory do I retain?
For example, I know that this is a plate, and I recognize what a spoon is.
And when she mentioned what kind of facility this is, I felt a vague sense of familiarity at the term.
Academia, researchers, white coats, test tubes.
It conjures a certain image in my mind.
But I can't recall anything about myself.
I can't see myself in any of the scenes my mind conjures.
Um, so you know who I am?
The girl nods.
Your name is Kaito. That is all the personal information you need to know right now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Kaito... then. You know more about me, don't you? Like my occupation? My age?
The girl nods.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But you can't tell me?
This information restriction is not permanent. When the time comes, you will be informed of everything.
But that moment isn't now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Am I being held here for some reason?
She shakes her head.
You gave your consent to everything that's happening here.
You agreed to your memory being tampered with and to the tests being run in this facility.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Before I lost my memory, you mean?
She nods again.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What do you mean by tests? Who's running this place?
The activity of your cerebral cortex is being recorded during sleep. Your role is to sleep in the designated room.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?
In short, we are recording your dreams.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Wha...
The facility provides for all your biological needs so that you are free to dream.
That is your role here.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I consented to my memory being wiped for this experiment?
She nods.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: There's no way for me to know if what you're saying is true. I have no memories at all.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You could be feeding me lies here.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Do you have any proof as to why I should believe you?
No.
Even if you don't believe me, that has no bearing on the recording activities being performed.
Whether you think I'm lying or not, you cannot leave this facility.
No matter how hard you fight it, you will eventually sleep. And I will record it.
Once you have done that for a sufficient amount of time, your role will be over and your memories returned.
I would point out that there is nothing that can cause you harm in this place.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So you're the one who's making these recordings?
She nods once more.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Who are you? An android?
She nods again.
You called me Izumo.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo... Are you a medical android?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I have not been granted permission to perform medical care. I am registered as a home assistance terminal. I am capable of assisting with academic research and monitoring biosignals.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ugh...

The white-haired girl murmurs something, but I can't quite make it out.
The girl has no plate in front of her.
Maybe she ate already.

I see that the white-haired girl is also eating.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Tasty...
The white-haired girl mutters in a soft tone.

texts.name: Shleep
texts.text: *Chirping*
I hear an electronic sound and turn my gaze towards its source. My eyes are met with a little snowman-shaped robot floating next to a girl.
The girl stares at me in silence.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I have not been granted permission to perform medical care. I am registered as a home assistance terminal. I am capable of assisting with academic research and monitoring biosignals.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see...
Her answer seems in line with the knowledge I have of androids.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: When does this 'role' end?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: When you finish the third dream.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Each of the three dreams has an end. When the time comes, you will understand.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Your dreams will progress.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Like stories.
I think back on the dreams from before.
They do feel like they have a sense of coherence and story-like progression, not to mention I can remember them eerily well.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't understand this experiment.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm confined here and given food and accommodations, just so you can record my dreams.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And I agreed to have my own memory wiped to do this?
Izumo nods.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What's it all for?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: You will understand when your memories are returned.
I blow out an exasperated sigh.
The white-haired girl finishes her meal and lays her spoon down on the plate.
Then she simply stares down at nothing.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Who is she?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Her name is Yonagi. Her dreams are being recorded together with yours.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So we're both test subjects?
Izumo nods again.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Can she not speak?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: All organs necessary for vocalization are functioning normally. It's not that she can't, she just won't.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Can she hear us?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: All of her senses are working normally. All the signals assigned to them reach her brain as they should.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Can she, uh, even hear us?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: All of her senses are working normally. All the signals assigned to them reach her brain as they should.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: It's not that she can't talk, she just won't.
I stare at the white-haired girl.
Yonagi is her name.
Her white hair and rose-colored eyes are very striking.
They don't look natural.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She looks so much like the person who appears in my dreams...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Is it a coincidence?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: No.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...I figured.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Who's running this sick experiment? Do I get to meet the person who's pulling the strings here?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: You will see them at the end.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: When I get my memories back, you mean?
Izumo bobs her head.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Is that your answer for everything?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Didn't you say it doesn't matter whether I believe you or not?
She nods again.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What if I kill myself here? Maybe I'd prefer banging my head against the walls to going along with your stupid game.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I could bite my tongue and choke on my blood.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: You have no memories. It is unlikely you are seriously thinking of ending your own life.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: The more you dream, the farther along you'll get.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: If you want your memories back, all you have to do is sleep.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: It's much more rational than taking your own life.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And if you're lying to me, I'm just gonna waste away and die here without knowing a thing.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Maybe you're not really recording our dreams at all, and this is some kind of sick amusement for some rich guy watching us.
Izumo just gives me a level stare.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm not saying that's what I think is happening here. I'm just saying that, if you tell me nothing, I could think the worst.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I will prove to you that we are recording your dreams.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: How?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: In the dream, you are Arishima Kaoru, a forty-five-year-old adjunct professor at Shuuhei Academy in Yumemi City, Kanagawa Prefecture, in the year 2016.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: He is married to Arishima Shouko, but their marriage is cold and dead. He and his wife engage only when necessary.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: One day, he learns that the daughter of Hatano Shuho, someone he knew back in his college days, is a student in one of his classes.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Arishima Kaoru then begins to harbor feelings of love for the girl, Hatano Rin.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: In the dream, you are William Shakespeare. He lives with his blind father in Tenbridge. They are Catholics.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Unable to make a living running his family's pub, he tries to steal a deer from a noble's garden, but is quickly captured. Then he is bought as a slave by Olivia Berry.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Ordered to write a masterpiece or forfeit his life, he unwillingly becomes the playwright of Olivia's acting troupe.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: In the dream, you are Amei Kanna, living in Nariyama City, Chiba Prefecture, in the year 2061. He is a little rebel who devotes himself to photography.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Thanks to a visit from a teacher in training, Momonouchi Sumomo, his father learns of his absence from the academy. After that, Kanna starts living in the garage to avoid facing his father.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: He then requests mechanic Matsukaze Azuki to repair the memento left by his mother: a 4x4 nicknamed 'Hachimaru.' But the vehicle is stolen and subsequently damaged further in his effort to take it back.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Azuki moves into the garage on the condition that she will repair Hachimaru, and Kanna is made to go to class as in exchange for keeping his and Azuki's criminal acts a secret.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay, I get it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You do seem very familiar with my dreams.
Izumo simply answers with a nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You don't seem like a con woman either.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: If the person with administrative rights over me orders it so, I can state things other than the facts available in my data banks.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Doesn't sound like something an actual liar would admit to.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Never mind.
She stares at me, the expression in her face glowing from its absence.
My attention is drawn to the spherical thing floating besides her.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What's what?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Wooleep.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: The digital sheep, Wooleep.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Wooleep?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Wooleep, yes.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Wooleep.
She gives a resolute nod.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Wooleep is the one recording your dreams. He also assists with preventing your dreams from duplicating or becoming corrupted in some manner.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: That's how you continue dreaming. Wooleep is constantly canceling out any information that would interfere with the dreams, so we cannot ignore the laws of physics.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Wooleep is an assistance terminal designed to control dreams and create simulations.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And he's a boy? You said 'he,' right?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: That was the intention of the person who named him.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I suppose having an identity is important.
She nods thoughtfully.

texts.name: Shleep
texts.text: *Affirmative beeping*
Wooleep emits an electronic chirp.
Maybe that's what passes for a nod in his case.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: To be honest, I still have a mountain of questions.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Yes?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But I don't feel like trying to escape from here right now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I suppose that's the reaction my captors predicted as well.
Izumo stares at me.
This facility looks anything but flimsy.
And it seems like this whole thing has been planned out well in advance.
I have too little information to act upon.
And...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm feeling really sleepy. My head feels heavy. Maybe it's some kind of side effect from having my memory wiped.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Unless there was something in the food...
Izumo shakes her head emphatically.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: What you just ate was boiled corn. You are currently experiencing drowsiness because your blood sugar levels have risen sharply.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: This facility has been designed as an ideal environment for the relaxation of the human body. The temperature and fragrance of this space have been chosen to ensure this.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You mean the smell of wood?
She nods.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: It is not as expedient as sleeping pills, but it causes no negative effects to you.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So I can sleep and wake up whenever I want?
She nods again.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So I've been put into an environment where I can stay in bed all day, and I have a personal android looking after me...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And all I gotta do is sleep?
She nods.
I can kind of see why I might have agreed to all this in the first place.
Not that I can remember what was on my mind at that moment.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It just sounds pretty sketchy, if you ask me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Am I getting anything from this? Am I being compensated in some manner?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: All I can say is that you consented to this experiment because you judged that to be the case.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: You weren't coerced to participate in any of this.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay. Now...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Could I get a tour of this place?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's not like I'm going anywhere, is it?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I will guide you.
With that, Izumo gets up.
I follow her lead, but Yonagi stays seated.
She remains in place, staring vacantly down at the table.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: *Sigh*
The facilities I can use are the dining and recreation rooms, the bathroom, and the rooftop that overlooks the city.
The recreation room is well stocked with children's toys and board games.
Not much recreation for me, I suppose.
Yonagi stayed back in the dining room, but I find her sitting on her bed when I get back to our room.
When I open the door, it doesn't elicit any reaction from her.
Izumo said that her senses are working normally.
Are they really, though?
There is only silence between us.
There are two beds in the room and a single basin.
Above the basin, a simple mirror is fixed to the wall.
With that, Izumo gets up.
I follow her lead.
Yonagi watches us then does the same.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...You coming?
Yonagi seems to be staring in my direction, but not actually at me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay then...

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: We have basically all the equipment you'll need for your daily lives. There are bathroom facilities and a simple recreation area as well.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see. So that's what we get in exchange for not being able to go outside?
Izumo walks at a brisk, soundless pace while the little robot floats after her.
I walk behind them, with Yonagi trailing behind me.
I can hear her bare feet slapping against the floor.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Can't we even see the outside?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: There is a rooftop.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'd like to see that.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Understood.
The elevator door opens in front of us.
The elevator door opens in front of us.
Cold air brushes against my cheeks.
I walk towards the railing and look up at the sky.
A wave of relief hits me.
This is the sky I know.
The round sky, surrounded by high walls.
The outside world is just as I... remember.
I look down.
Mid-rise dwellings and high-rise buildings spread out around the high walls.
And above that, the sky is blue and the sun dazzling.
This is the world I know.
Without my memories, I can't really judge how much of my perception is correct.
But this is the Japan I know. I know in my heart that this is Shinjuku.
I wonder if anyone has found a way to really stand under that sky.
It doesn't look like much has changed from the mental image I seem to have, so the answer is probably no.
Taking a deep breath, I notice tiny dust particles mixed into the air.
The air indoors is a lot cleaner than outside.
That too...
...is the world I know.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: *Cough*
I look back to find Yonagi coughing with a frown on her face.
Maybe she's not used to the air out here.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Wanna go back?
She bobs her head.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: *Sigh*
After coming back from the rooftop, I'm shown the bathroom and the recreation area.
The recreation room is well stocked with children's toys and board games.
No much recreation for me, I suppose.
Yonagi follows me the whole time. When we get back to our room, she goes straight to her bed and sits down.
There is only silence between us.
There are two beds in the room and a single basin.
Above the basin, a simple mirror is fixed to the wall.
With that, Izumo gets up.
I follow her lead.
Yonagi watches us then does the same.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...You coming?
She nods and leaves her seat.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: We have basically all the equipment you'll need for your daily lives. There are bathroom facilities and a simple recreation area as well.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see. So that's what we get in exchange for not being able to go outside?
Izumo walks at a brisk, soundless pace while the little robot floats after her.
I walk behind them, with Yonagi trailing behind me.
I can hear her bare feet slapping against the floor.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Can't we even see the outside?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: There is a rooftop.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'd like to see that.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Understood.
The elevator door opens in front of us.
A cool air blows onto our faces as it does.
When I move to step outside...
Yonagi stops me, pulling on my sleeve.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You don't wanna go?
She shakes her head.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: *Cough*
She lets out a small cough.
Right, the air outside is pretty dusty.
That's how it's always been in Underground Shinjuku.
The air is cleaner indoors.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Do you want to wait inside?
Yonagi languidly turns to Izumo and bobs her head.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Wooleep, stay with her.

texts.name: Shleep
texts.text: *Happy chirping*
Izumo and I go out onto the rooftop while Yonagi and Wooleep stay behind.
Yonagi stares at me until the elevator doors close.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Yonagi doesn't seem to like this place particularly.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Seems not.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Is it... okay to leave her alone?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Hm? She's with Wooleep.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh? Ah, yeah, right.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Everything inside the facility is being constantly monitored. There is no need to worry.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...So she doesn't need Wooleep, does she?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Just in case.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: In case of what?
Izumo simply nods and starts walking.
I follow after her.
It's a little cold outside.
I walk towards the railing and look up at the sky.
A wave of relief hits me.
This is the sky I know.
The round sky, surrounded by high walls.
The outside world is just as I... remember.
Looking down, I see a large domed plaza in front of me.
It's surrounded by high walls of gray concrete.
And above that, the sky is blue and the sun dazzling.
This is the world I know.
Without my memories, I can't really judge how much of my perception is correct.
But this is the Japan I know. I know in my heart that this is Shinjuku.
I wonder if anyone has found a way to really stand under that sky.
It doesn't look like much has changed from the mental image I seem to have, so the answer is probably no.
Taking a deep breath, I notice tiny dust particles mixed into the air.
The air indoors is a lot cleaner than outside.
That too...
...is the world I know.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...I get it.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think I have some degree of knowledge about the world.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It seems like I'm in a state of total amnesia.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: That is correct. However, since it is an artificially-induced state of amnesia, it's different, yet deceptively similar, to the condition you describe.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Will this heal naturally?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: You will understand when your memories return.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.
I look up at the round window of the sky once again.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Thanks. Let's head back.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Yes.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Where did Yonagi go?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: She's in the recreation area.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The what?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: This way.
The room Izumi guides me to is filled with children's toys and board games.
And in the middle of it, Yonagi is...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: A picture book?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: It seems so, yes.
I slowly approach her.
She looks up at me as I come closer.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You're reading the picture book?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...Yes.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Is it fun?
She nods.

texts.name: Shleep
texts.text: *Chirp*
Yonagi's attention returns to the book, and she flips a page.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What kind of story is it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: It seems like she's focused on the book.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...She's just like a kid.

texts.name: Shleep
texts.text: *Chirp*
The room Izumi guides me to is filled with children's toys and board games.
And in the middle of it, Yonagi is...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Dolls?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: It seems so, yes.
She's playing with dolls, holding one in each hand so that they're facing each other.
I slowly approach her.
She looks up at me as I come closer.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Are they talking to each other?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...Yes.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Is it fun?
She nods.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Pow pow pow.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Paw paw paw.
The doll in her left hand is chasing after the one in her right hand.
I wonder if there's any story behind it.

texts.name: Shleep
texts.text: *Chirp*

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Bonk.
The doll on the left seems to have caught up with the other one.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Why is it chasing the other?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: It seems like she's focused on playing.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...She's just like a kid.

texts.name: Shleep
texts.text: *Chirp*
The room Izumi guides me to is filled with children's toys and board games.
And in the middle of it, Yonagi is...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Are those paints?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: It seems so, yes.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What's she doing over there?
I slowly approach her.
She looks up at me as I come closer.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Are you painting your nails?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...Nails.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You're painting them?
She nods.

texts.name: Shleep
texts.text: *Chirp*
She's painting the nails of her left hand one by one.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Uh...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm?
Yonagi frowns down at her nails for a moment.
Then she picks up one paint bottle, examines it, and puts it back on the floor before moving on to the next.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Sparkly sparkly... Sparkly...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Sparkly? Ah...
I reach out and pick up the pot of glittery paint.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Is this the one you're looking for?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Sparkly!
She swipes the paint out of my hand and resumes painting her nails.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah! Sparkly!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...She's just like a kid.

texts.name: Shleep
texts.text: *Chirp*
I get up and look back at Izumo.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Could you show me around the rest of the place?
She nods dutifully in response.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I will show you the bathroom.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: *Sigh*
The bathroom turned out to be a simple shower room with an attached changing room.
I sit down on the bed.
This place is so strange.
Does that Yonagi girl have some kind of impediment?
There's a disparity between the impression she gives off and her actions that I can't quite reconcile.
Mentally, she seems really young.
There are two beds in the room and a single basin.
Above the basin, a simple mirror is fixed to the wall.
I stand in front of it and take a good look at myself.
So this is my face.
I reach out a hand toward my reflection in the mirror.
I have some serious crow's feet carved into the corners of my eyes and panda-like bags beneath them.
My face looks distressingly gaunt.
I see now that the reason I'm sleepy isn't just because I'm in a comfortable environment.
I've clearly been suffering from a severe lack of sleep.
What in the world have I been doing?
Depending on how you look at it, one could say I'm lucky.
That android, Izumo, seems to at least know me.
Simply having my dreams monitored seems harmless enough for now.
Perhaps a better arrangement than being thrown out onto the streets without any memories.
They even feed me here.
I've gotta consider the possibility that my memories might come back on their own.
I look back and see Yonagi still lying prone.
She's sleeping on her right side, one arm under the pillow.
I sit down on my bed.
Her face is turned this way.
She has her eyes closed.
I also lie down and rest my head on the pillow.
I stare at the ceiling for a while.
I hear the faint whirring of the air conditioning.
And the scent of cedar reaches my nose.
...Yes, cedar.
I'm in a state of near total amnesia.
But I get the feeling that I used to be someone with a good memory.
The soft sheets urge me toward sleep.
And I notice the light in the room gradually dimming.
All at once, I'm in the dark.
I feel my consciousness slipping.
A sweet numbness wraps around my body as the boundaries between wakefulness and sleep melt away.
Did someone call my name?
No, must have been my imagination.
I stare at the ceiling again then close my eyes.
When I do, I see an afterimage of Yonagi's peaceful sleeping visage.
The sound of her breathing reaches my ears together with the soft buzz of the air conditioner.
For some reason, I find it strangely comforting.
And soon, my consciousness starts to slip.
Again, to that dream...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito...
My eyes snap open.
The sound was unfamiliar and unexpected.
Kaito... I see. That’s my name.
Still a little dazed in the dark, I turn to Yonagi.
Did she call my name?
No, must have been my imagination.
I stare at the ceiling again then close my eyes.
When I do, I see an afterimage of Yonagi's peaceful sleeping visage.
The sound of her breathing reaches my ears together with the soft buzz of the air conditioner.
For some reason, I find it strangely comforting.
And soon, my consciousness starts to slip.
Again, to that dream...
